programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A street artist's mural is stolen, and the investigation leads to a conspiracy regarding a Navy contractor and the safety of ocean mammals; Bishop shares a special connection with the street artist.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: McGee and Bishop travel to Afghanistan after a murder case in the states is linked to a string of soldiers killed by friendly fire overseas; Kasie leaves the lab and accompanies Torres into the field to process additional forensic evidence.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team begins an undercover stakeout when their lead suspect in an old unsolved case is released from prison.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team's holiday plans are put on hold when a murder investigation leads to the discovery of a newborn baby who has no identification and no apparent ties to a family.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: Sue's next assignment hits closer to home - when she is called in to investigate a kidnapping of a deaf student.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: Sue and Lucy take in Lucy's grandmother after con men swindle the elderly woman out of her house - and set up a sting to bring the "contractors" to justice.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: Sue and the FBI team capture an Al Qaeda leader planning an attack in D.C.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: Sue and Jack investigate the claim of a Deaf holocaust survivor (guest star Tony Award winner Phyllis Frelich) who insists she's recently seen a wanted Nazi war criminal.

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: The team finds itself in a tense and unprecedented situation when Bull faces off against Marissa and her new boss in court, following her departure from the company; Taylor's professional life works against her during her custody battle.

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: The TAC team gets a rare glimpse into Bull's personal life when his estranged brother of 13 years, Jacob Bull, unexpectedly arrives; a financial investor is accused by the FBI of running a Ponzi scheme with his father.

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: Bull helps his friend mount a diminished capacity defense for a sergeant accused of killing a fellow soldier; a French gallery owner needs legal assistance to stop an auction house from selling a piece of art that should be repatriated.

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: Bull helps an agoraphobic client bring a wrongful death suit against the alleged killer of his beloved aunt, but the client's inability to testify in person threatens the trial; Chunk's new relationship hits a snag when his mother visits.

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: The surgeon who saved Bull's life after his heart attack is sued for malpractice; Taylor fights the urge to check into the background of Henri Fray, Marissa's new love interest.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team heads to Austin to investigate when victims with watches set to inaccurate times are discovered; the team's stalker gets closer.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Victims of the Replicator, the BAU's stalker, turn up in Philadelphia; the members of the team think they are getting close to apprehending their suspect.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team investigates victims who were sharing details about their personal lives and inner desires online; Kevin becomes jealous when he finds out that Garcia might have a new love interest.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When the team goes to Morgan's old neighborhood to track an UnSub targeting middle-aged men, Morgan suspects they are looking for someone connected to the man who abused him as a child.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: A 25-year-old time capsule opened in a small Colorado town reveals a gruesome discovery and a possible connection to a local police officer's death.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team heads to Rapid City when two men are murdered in a ritualistic way; Reid mourns Maeve's death.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU team heads to Los Angeles in search of a suspect who kidnaps nannies and the children they care for.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team tracks a suspect targeting people in Detroit; Blake receives a life-changing proposition from her husband (D.W. Moffett).

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: The team rushes to track down two doctors abducted by a desperate father willing to do anything to save his son; Jubal's uncertainty in his family life affects his judgement during the hostage situation.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: When the CEO of a major brokerage firm is killed while surrounded by protesters, the team looks into who had the most to lose from his company's perceived manipulations; Scola's previous Wall Street career and the reasons he left come to light.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: While investigating a mass casualty incident at a New York City restaurant, the team scrambles to determine if it was racially motivated and if there was more than one gunman; Maggie starts to notice troubling behavior from her co-worker Elise.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: When five prominent men are gunned down at a trendy New York restaurant, the team's investigation brings them into contact with a lieutenant in Antonio Vargas' cartel, triggering a showdown between Isobel and Vargas.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: After a young woman is killed on her way home from a lavish yacht party, the team investigates who she was and how she came to be at the event.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: Maggie, OA and the team must stop a hacker who is disabling life-saving equipment in several New York City hospitals; Jubal's son waits for important surgery at one of the impacted hospitals.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: The team finds a connection between bombings and a private veterans' club in New York City; Isobel tells a reluctant OA to recruit a former Army buddy for intel.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Mike Hammer is on the beat after the untimely death of former policeman Chic Farrell's death. After Mike finds Chic's son dead in a heroin house, the former cop is burning for revenge. Chic's own murder leaves Mike Hammer alone to find the killers, and the only witness is a strung out hooker who's on the run. The Russians and their steady supply of heroin to the city put them high up on Hammer's list of suspects.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Mike Hammer is hired to investigate a toxic chemical dump in the Hudson River by Patrick Dean, the man accused of the crime. Hammer is no fan of tabloids, but his sleuthing uncovers new headlines of his own. While looking to clear his name, the journalist who broke the story and incriminated Patrick is found dead. Now, Hammer starts to suspect that his client might not be as clean as he claimed to be.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: The virtual world has real consequences in Mike Hammer's latest case. Mike Hammer is offered a case by the worried grandmother of a missing young woman. Tamara had been working as a model for a racy website before her disappearance, and when Hammer's team discovers a snuff film posted online, he worries that she may have been victimized by something much more serious. Mike Hammer is on the case to either find Tamara, or bring her murderers to justice.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Mayron Hughes may be one of the most sought after basketball players in the country, but the mysterious death of his former agents could threaten everything. The star athlete hires New York's most valuable private eye in order to prove his own innocence. The case becomes increasingly complicated, and the Hammer must look at an entire roster of suspects in order to find the real killer. From Mayron father to his new agent to Mayron himself, anyone could be the culprit.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Sam is shot during a firefight with the cartel; an interrogated suspect reveals new information on the whereabouts of Spencer Williams, the man who kidnapped Mosley's son.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Despite several team members having reservations, the team travels to Mexico to locate and rescue Mosley's son.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: After a mission in Mexico, Callen, Sam and Kensi must find a way home with an unconscious Deeks in tow; Mosely and retired Navy Admiral Hollace Kilbride look for assistance with their missing colleagues.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A prototype tactical assault suit is stolen from a Navy base and used in a jewelry heist; the team must determine who stole the suit and what their next target is; retired Navy Admiral Hollace Kilbride temporarily oversees the team.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Callen and Sam are assigned protection duty for Deputy Crown Prince Kamal after an assassin targets his decoy upon arrival in Los Angeles.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Boden takes a big step in the pursuit of a major career decision; Kidd becomes increasingly distrustful of Renee's motives with Severide; Herrmann has trouble bouncing back after a tragedy.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Boden's chances for a promotion are met with potential complications; Dawson and Casey don't see eye to eye on an important decision; Kidd finds herself struggling to find time with Severide; Brett and Dawson respond to a tough call.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Reeling from Dawson's continued absence, Casey makes a rash move during a rescue, while Brett struggles with a series of replacement partners; meanwhile, Boden faces scrutiny from Commissioner Grissom, who sends his deputy to monitor Firehouse 51.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Firehouse 51 bands together to fight a raging fire on the 20th floor of the residential high-rise where Jay and Will Halstead's father lives and has gone missing; in the midst of the chaos, Brett learns unsettling information about her new partner.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Severide investigates a victim's motives after rescuing him and his child from a car accident; Boden clashes with Gorsch over appointing a new lieutenant; Mouch reaches out to a fellow firefighter; Cruz discovers he has a new admirer.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Herrmann faces hazing in his new role as lieutenant; Foster suspects a young gymnast's injury is more than meets the eye; Severide is jealous of Kidd's best friend; Casey and Boden turn to P.D. after treating two victims who have similar injuries.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Casey helps a reporter uncover the truth behind a trailer park fire; Boden attempts to make peace with Grissom; Hermann, Otis and Kidd take action when Molly's receives a bad Yelp review; Severide reaches out to his father for a favor.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Gorsch continues his reign of terror at Firehouse 51, taking over Boden's morning meeting and going out on calls in Boden's place; Brett and Foster respond to a call where a Halloween prank has turned deadly serious.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Kidd and the team embark on a mission to help Severide as he struggles to process his father Benny's death; Brett suspects a teenage driver in a car accident is hiding something.

programme.title: European Poker Tour - Episode 1
programme.desc: The European Poker Tour celebrates its 20th anniversary in Barcelona, the city where it all began. Nearly 2,000 players compete in the Main Event for a 1.5m first prize.

programme.title: European Poker Tour - Episode 2
programme.desc: Day 2 of the European Poker Tour Main Event continues, with PSPC champion Ramon Colillas, the USA's Rania Nasreddine and Canada's Griffin Benger among the players hoping to survive the session and stay in contention for the title, trophy.

programme.title: European Poker Tour - Episode 3
programme.desc: Theyre on the bubble in the European Poker Tour Main Event. The next six players to be eliminated will leave with nothing. The rest will be guaranteed a slice of the 9.5m prize pool. Can YouTube star Wolfgang Poker and Canadian pro Griffin Benger make it into the money? (3/11)

programme.desc: The European Poker Tour celebrates its 20th anniversary in Barcelona, the city where it all began. Nearly 2,000 players compete in the Main Event for a 1.5m first prize.

programme.title: European Poker Tour - Episode 2
programme.desc: Day 2 of the European Poker Tour Main Event continues, with PSPC champion Ramon Colillas, the USA's Rania Nasreddine and Canada's Griffin Benger among the players hoping to survive the session and stay in contention for the title, trophy.

programme.title: European Poker Tour - Episode 3
programme.desc: Theyre on the bubble in the European Poker Tour Main Event. The next six players to be eliminated will leave with nothing. The rest will be guaranteed a slice of the 9.5m prize pool. Can YouTube star Wolfgang Poker and Canadian pro Griffin Benger make it into the money? (3/11)

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Angel Hernandez vs. Rayne Wells, Jessica Borga vs. Katharina Lehner, Jay Jackson vs. Idrees Wasi and Abdiel Velazquez vs. Travis Thompson help kick off a nine-fight Fight Night in Clearwater, Florida.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Some of the most dominant performances from KnuckleMania IV. Mike Perry headlines against Thiago Alves, Lorenzo Hunt looks to make history against heavyweight champ Mick Terrill, Jeremiah Riggs welcomes Alfredo Angulo to the Squared Circle.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Before the halfway point of the evening, Los Angeles had already put on a phenomenal show. Complete with upsets, dominance and five-round bangers.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: In a historic and first ever trip to Connecticut's Mohegan Sun Casino, Natalie Gage vs. Sarah Click, Rick Hawn vs. Stephen Stengel, Mike Trizano vs. Louie Lopez and Jimmie Rivera vs. Daniel Straus make an outstanding account for BKFC talent.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: A stacked fight card in Omaha features some heavy hitters in intriguing matchups! Watch BRAUN vs MCINTOSH, GROSU vs MARTINEZ,COCHRANE vs HOLLOWAY &TRINIDAD-SNAKE vs PAGUE as they battle during a Fight Night.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: In three epic clashes, JOSH KREJCI welcomes NATE MORROW to the Squared Circle,TOMMY STRYDOM takes on COREY ROBERTS and BOBBY TAYLOR goes to war with RYAN ROBERTS. Don't miss these incredible showings of toughness from Omaha!

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Prospects throw down in a handful of first-time showings in Denver with RAMIRO FIGUEROA vs BRETT HUDSON and JOSH HUBER vs ANDREW YATES. Also, in BKFC veteran matchups, CRISTINA CRIST, CASSIE ROBB, SAWYER DEPEE and KEEGAN VANDERMEER match up.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Watch some serious showings of toughness and skill asJOSEPH CREER vs DANIEL MITCHELL,ZEB VINCENT vs CASEY MOSES,DERRICK FINDLEY vs SERGIO LOPEZ &DYLAN SCHULTE vs ROBERTO ARMAS lay it all on the line in Denver.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Three titles are on the line in Hollywood, Florida with WARREN vs ESCOBOZA fighting for light heavyweight gold, BLAS vsRICHARDSON battling at bantamweight and bad blood boils over as BRYAN DURAN comes for KAI STEWART'S featherweight strap!

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Watch Brandon Conley battle Keith Richardson, Chase Gormely fight Tylor Sijohn and three more epic battles from Los Angeles!

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: In a showcase of incredible bare-knuckle matchmaking,LEONARDO PERDOMO vs LEO BERCIER,GEE PEREZ vs ALBERT INCLAN,CHRISTINE VICENS vs MELANIE SHAH &JUSTIN IBARROLA vs RICK CARUSO demonstrate the grittiness of BKFC.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: In four tough-fought wars, we see none of these bouts go the distance! Watch BKFC talent battle with SIMPSON vs SUAREZ,ZUCKERMAN vs CEDENO,PLAZAOLA vs DODSON &GARCIA vs LIVINGSTON at BKFC 62.

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: In an absolutely electric showing for the BKFC debut at the Pechanga Resort & Casino,VICTOR ROSAS vs LUIS INIGUEZ,FERNANDO GONZALEZ vs RODNEY THOMAS &RUBEN WARR vs ROBBIE PERALTA shock the crowd with jaw-dropping scraps!

programme.title: BKFC: Knuckle Up
programme.desc: Watch exceptional matchups & brutal finishes from Pechanga's first ever BKFC Fight Night! Featuring HANSEN vs YOST,VO vs PETTIT,GUTIERREZ vs GARCIA &VILLASENOR vs FIELDS.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The $1,000 Ladies Event attracted 201 entrants and would see the final table headlined by Karina Jett and Susie Isaacs as nine lucky ladies look to capture the WSOP bracelet and $58,530 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The $5,000 Seven Card Stud World Championship attracted 144 entrants and created a prize pool of $676,800. The WSOP bracelet and $221,000 first-place prize would look to be claimed by a savvy group of final tablists that included Marcel Luske, Jeff Lisandro, Joe Awada, Cory Zeidman, Dewey Tomko and John Juanda.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Phil Hellmuth headlines the $3,000 Pot-Limit Hold'em final table that includes Ram Vaswani and Phi Nguyen, while Gavin Griffin chases the title of youngest WSOP bracelet of all-time if he can emerge victorious. Who will win the $270,420 first-place prize and prestigious WSOP bracelet?

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The only straight Razz tournament of the 2004 WSOP would see a field of 195 players. Chris Bjorin, Hoyt Corkins, John Juanda, Howard Lederer, and Dutch Boyd all look to deny T.J. Cloutier his fifth WSOP bracelet as all eyes are on the $90,500 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The Event #5: $10,000 8-Game final table is set at the 2022 Poker Masters! Cary Katz is the chip leader ahead of Nick Guagenti, Alex Livingston, Steve Zolotow, Benjamin Diebold, Jacky Wang, and Brian Rast, as the final seven players play for the $186,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: Pokerography

programme.title: The Nightcap
programme.desc: On The Nightcap we explore and question other lifestyles and cultures with an enthusiastic, open mind and hope to leave our viewers happily pondering new perspectives. The show's unique set has a full bar with a rotating cast of bartenders pouring up unique cocktails you can try to replicate at home. Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. From game night to ordering in munchies, The Nightcap will keep you wanting more. It's sexy, it's risqu, it's everything you wouldn't expect from late-night TV.

programme.title: The Pulse With Bill Anderson
programme.desc: The Pulse with Bill Anderson is a weekly tv program and podcast featuring topical discussions and interviews surrounding current local issues, events, and entertainment. Each week Bill will welcome guests from all walks of life to talk about the topics that have the attention of our community and beyond. The Pulse will air weekly on FOX 29 in Philly as well as FOX Soul nationwide and be distributed on all major podcast outlets. In addition to hosting The Pulse Bill also manages the content of the station's special reports, including the Our Race Reality series of segments and specials. He also reports on the brighter side of life in his regular news series For Goodness' Sake.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
The episode that has gone down in TV history. Tim Gray was the 21 year-old Head Chef at Bonaparte's in Silsden, West Yorkshire. Claiming to specialise in "fine dining", he had ambitions to be a TV chef and dreamed of opening restaurants in London, Paris and New York. Unfortunately, Tim couldn't even cook an omelette and his trademark scallops made Ramsay throw up. A true kitchen nightmare if ever there was one.
With no customers and a fridge full of fancy ingredients, Bonaparte's was losing money fast. Ramsay soon established that what the people of Silsden really want to eat is Beef and Ale Pie and Treacle Tart. Ramsay soon had the restaurant chocker block but what state is it in now?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
Saturday night at The Glass House Restaurant in Ambleside was a disaster. Orders in the kitchen were mixed up, the food wasn't cooked properly and the customers were complaining. Not only was the chef in tears, but the owners were on the brink of bankruptcy.
A few months on, there have been some departures from the Glass House. Who is in charge of the kitchen now? And, more importantly, is Ramsay's Caesar salad still on the menu?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
Nick and Richard are self-confessed restaurant virgins. They've both had successful careers in the brewery business so when they bought Moore Place they believed they could make it an instant success. What they hadn't realized was just how difficult it would be to fill the 90-seater oak-paneled restaurant and how hard it would be to find a chef who could cook decent food.
Has Ramsay's fast-track guide to restaurant success helped these brewery whiz-kids transform their failing ex-Berni Inn into a profitable business? And is the building still painted that disgusting shade of purple?

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty shows how to harvest and store potatoes. He also adds late summer colour to the cottage garden and prunes shrub roses. Carol Klein travels to Norfolk to meet Adrian Bloom, a member of a horticultural dynasty.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's thoughts turn to spring when he gives recommendations for bulbs to plant that will thrive in pots. He also shows how to prune summer fruiting raspberries. In Norfolk, Frances Tophill visits a gardener who at 97 still gardens every day.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It is the autumn equinox and Monty celebrates the season's apple bounty. Monty also plans for Christmas when he plants bulbs to brighten dark winter days, and he gives advice on planting garlic for the following year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty shows how to prune and train the summer growth of climbing roses and makes the most of the seasonal warmth by planting perennials and sowing annuals. Frances Tophill visits a viewer's garden to give advice on how to prune unruly shrubs.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Across the country `Gardeners' World' presenters, from their own gardens and homes, give advice and share their knowledge to enable people to get the most out of their gardens. For further inspiration, professionals, horticulturists and hobby gardeners provide fellow green-fingered enthusiasts with useful tips and suggestions, no matter the size of garden or level of expertise. Whether it is creating depth in a small, backyard garden or how to make the most of the latest spinach crop with homemade pesto, presenters prove that the possibilities are endless for any gardener and garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first signs of spring herald the start of the new gardening year. Monty Don reveals the changes he has made to his garden over the winter, tackles timely pruning tasks and shows the best way to lay a new path. Meanwhile, snowdrops are lighting up the winter garden and Carol Klein is out and about in Oxfordshire celebrating their staggering diversity.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As April gets under way, Monty Don begins the process of reinvigorating his Jewel Garden where, over the coming months, he will be using plants which will give an evolving tapestry of colour over the seasons. Elsewhere, Carol Klein revels in the glory of one the world's most renowned camellia collections when she visits Mount Edgcumbe on the banks of the River Tamar in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants a vine to grow dessert grapes and looks at varieties that can be grown outside as well as in a greenhouse. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at home in Glebe Cottage where she reveals a little of the fascinating history of one of our spring favourites, Trillium grandiflorum. Plus, Rachel de Thame explores a suburban, hidden garden with charms all of its own.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the Gardeners' World team look back at the horticultural highs of the latest series and celebrate the very best inspirational gardens and gardeners up and down the country.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the Gardeners' World team look back at the horticultural highlights from the latest series and celebrate the very best inspirational gardens and gardeners up and down the country.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don visits two sets of ambitious gardeners, each facing challenges on a very different scale. One is a tiny urban courtyard in Hackney and the other is a outdoor area for a community.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty meets two sets of gardeners who have unimaginable ambitions for their outdoor spaces. In Essex Denise has never ventured beyond the decking area behind her house. Meanwhile in Ipswich, a father and daughter plan to build a terraced allotment.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first signs of spring herald the start of the new gardening year. Monty Don reveals the changes he has made to his garden over the winter, tackles timely pruning tasks and shows the best way to lay a new path. Meanwhile, snowdrops are lighting up the winter garden and Carol Klein is out and about in Oxfordshire celebrating their staggering diversity.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don reveals plans for a new raised seating area, surrounded by wild flowers. Carol looks at the blossom at Battsford Arboretum in the Cotswolds and now the risk of frosts should have passed, Monty plants beans and courgettes in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Across the country `Gardeners' World' presenters, from their own gardens and homes, give advice and share their knowledge to enable people to get the most out of their gardens. For further inspiration, professionals, horticulturists and hobby gardeners provide fellow green-fingered enthusiasts with useful tips and suggestions, no matter the size of garden or level of expertise. Whether it is creating depth in a small, backyard garden or how to make the most of the latest spinach crop with homemade pesto, presenters prove that the possibilities are endless for any gardener and garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty begins the process of taking out plants which are in the wrong place and either moving or dividing others. He also gives advice on making leaf mould from fallen leaves and how to use it.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plans for next year's fruit harvest when he adds gooseberries to the fruit garden he planted earlier in the year. He also divides and moves herbaceous perennials and advises on the best bulbs to plant now for cut flowers next year. Frances Tophill meets a couple who have filled their garden with tender plants and devised a meticulous method of protecting them over the winter.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As October progresses and nights become colder, Monty advises on what plants need protection and how to protect tender plants over the coming months. Adam Frost travels to Peterborough to find out about the work of a Children in Need project for disadvantaged and vulnerable children.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has ideas for pots which will remain colourful throughout winter, gives tips on how to protect tender banana plants and harvests pumpkins. Frances Tophill helps a viewer whose overgrown pond needs some renovation, Adam Frost visits a garden in Nottinghamshire where the season of winter highlights its design.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: A new gardening year begins at Longmeadow and Monty reveals his new plans for the year as well as taking stock of any winter damage. As well as seasonal hints and tips he is embarking on a mission to reduce the use of plastic in his garden and starts by exploring alternative containers to use for seed sowing. Adam Frost brings his design expertise to a tiny back yard to demonstrate that no matter how small, with a bit of ingenuity, every space can count when it comes to gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets going in his vegetable garden sowing seeds for a bountiful summer and growing some more unusual vegetables as well as recommending varieties of summer bulbs to plant in spring. Plus, Mark Lane creates a floral celebration in a container.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Despite the slow awakening of the garden, there are still plenty of jobs to be getting on with and Monty begins to divide ornamental grasses, gives advice on what to do with containers which are past their best, plants up a colourful alpine trough and gives advice on what to sow now in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As part of his planning for summer Monty begins to sow annual climbers and gets started on tidying and mulching his borders. In the last of Joe Swift's series on trees, he learns how and when to prune them, and why. We also meet clematis enthusiast, Mike Brown, whose collection fills his garden with colour all summer long, and amongst the brutalist architecture of London's Barbican, Nick Bailey, head gardener of the Chelsea Physic Garden, discovers a hidden tropical oasis.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty is planning for next summer by sowing a batch of sweet peas. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is amongst the leaves, bark and berries at Thorp Perrow Arboretum in Yorkshire admiring the onset of the autumn display. Plus, there's a visit to Ryton Gardens in Warwickshire to find out about their collection of heritage vegetables and how to collect their seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty demonstrates that it is not too late to start growing vegetables by showing us which types to sow now, and adds some summer colour to the Spring Garden by sinking plants in pots into the borders. We meet a hosta National Collection holder, who shares the secrets of his propagating success, and Rachel de Thame pays a visit to the garden of theatre impresario Sir Cameron Mackintosh.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets his new vegetable garden underway by making raised beds. He also offers advice on how to cut back herbs. Nick Bailey marks the 400th anniversary of the death of William Shakespeare when he investigates the fact and the fiction behind the Bard's potions and poisons, at the Chelsea Physic Garden; and we visit Pashley Manor in East Sussex to unearth the story behind the planting of over 25,000 tulips.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets to work in his wildlife garden to ensure that there are plenty of plants in flower for early pollinators. Carol Klein meets Stuart Donachie who has embraced every planting opportunity in his shady garden in Herefordshire, and Frances Tophill invites viewers to grow easy summer vegetables along with her as she trials varieties for taste and productivity at RHS Rosemoor.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty comes to the rescue of two couples in need of help transforming their rubble filled back gardens into havens of peace and tranquillity. They are in serious need of help and advice but can Monty set them on the right track?

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Two gardeners, each living on their own, are hoping Monty can help them. In Blackpool, Alex dreams of turning her boring back yard into a magical enchanted forest. Also in Bristol, Ross has taken on a very over-grown allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Leyton, Tariq and Sairah want to turn their dumping ground of a back yard into a sumptuous award-winning garden, suitable for entertaining friends and family. Both have competitive jobs in the banking sector and are used to winning at work but when it comes to gardening, they don't know where to begin.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don revels in his passion for roses as he sets about planting some bare root varieties in the Jewel Garden at Longmeadow in readiness for a colourful spring and summer. Continuing the rose theme, there is an inspirational visit to the magnificent formal rose garden of Hever Castle in Kent, home to a breathtaking collection of hybrid teas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first big gardening weekend of the year gets underway with Monty dividing perennials and giving plenty of tips for how we can kick-start the garden for the season ahead. As millions of bedding plants are poised for planting in our pots and borders, Joe Swift visits a major grower to find out how they are produced and what drives the demand.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty is planning for next summer by sowing a batch of sweet peas. programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has got advice on taking cuttings from favourite roses to bulk up stock for free. He is also sowing in the vegetable garden now for a winter salad harvest right up until Christmas, and planning ahead and planting a beautiful display of narcissi and foxgloves to enjoy next spring and summer. Meanwhile, Carol Kelin is at Glebe Cottage collecting seeds from her favourite flowering perennials.

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: his week, I welcome back Capt. Neill Holland of Ocean Aid 360! Ocean Aid 360 along with Reef Relief, Surfrider, CCA, Beach Weekend, FWC, and NOAA, are leading a THREE DAY marine debris cleanup event that spans four hours each day, featuring daily raffle prizes, free lunches, and swag bags. They are inviting walkers, boaters, kayakers, and paddlers to join forces for a much-needed cleanup of the area. You can participate for one day or all three! Not only will you have a chance to WIN major prizes through daily raffles, but you'll also be contributing to the preservation of marine habitats and wildlife.The event starts 9/13/23 and ends 9/15/23. You can learn more and join this clean up here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/key-haven-coastal-community-cleanup-tickets-709576130307?aff=ebdsoporgprofileAt Ocean Aid 360, the belief is clear: environmental preservation and the livelihoods of marine-dependent communities are inseparable. Captain Neill Holland, a St. Pete, Florida native with a rich background in marine conservation, shares his journey from a career at National Geographic magazine to leading this impactful non-profit.Tune in to gain insights into the remarkable work of Ocean Aid 360 and Captain Neill Holland's dedication to the preservation of our marine ecosystems. It's an episode filled with hope, innovation, and a shared vision of a brighter future for our oceans.Follow Capt Neill on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/gofishtampabay/Follow OCEAN AID 360 on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/oceanaid360https://www.oceanaid360.orghttps://www.gofishtampabay.com#MarineConservation #OceanAid360 #MarineDebrisCleanup #CommunityCleanup #CleanOceans #EnvironmentalStewardship #MarineHabitat #VolunteerForChange #SaveOurSeas #EcoFriendly #WildlifeProtection #SustainableLiving #ProtectTheOcean #RafflePrizes #BeachCleanup #ConservationHeroes #EnvironmentalPartnerships #OceanProtection #CoastalCleanup #CleanerOceans #TeamSeasWEBSITES:http://www.saltwaterexperience.comhttp://www.tomrowlandpodcast.comSTREAM ALL OUR FULL SEASONS ON WAYPOINT TV: http://waypointtv.com/#!/saltwaterexperience

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: On opening day of Missouris gun season, hunters from around the state seek ridges and box blinds throughout the Show Me state in search of mature whitetail bucks. For Nikki Boxler and the Winchester Deer Camp, its no different. With Winchesters in hand, Nikki and crew play cat and mouse with several mature bucks at Indian Hill Outfitters in Pike County.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Every season, just like clockwork, mission-driven longboards gobble their way across the plains of South Dakota, the cornfields of Iowa, the timbered ridges of Michigan and the cattle ground of Kansas looking for their soulmates in one of the most celebrated hunting seasons in Americathe wild turkey breeding season. Join Team Winchester as they stalk, call, flank and roost boss gobblers into range from coast to coast.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Everything is bigger in Texas, including the stories. With the whitetail rut in the midwest winding down, the Winchester Life Crew of Chris Keefer, Casey Keefer, Nikki Boxler and Paul Sawyer head south to the Texas Panhandle with Winchesters in hand hoping to wrangle in a few Texas-sized giants.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country cant be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Florida, Olympian Dania Vizzi trains at her home shooting facility and talk about how she went from ballerina to one of the best shotgun shooters in the world. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. Finally well take a look into the National African American Gun Association and learn how one day at the range for Phillip Smith created the fastest growing firearm organization in the United States.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Throughout the season we get a lot of footage that never makes it on the show and isn't enough for a whole episode, so we put it together here in Bits & Bites.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryans passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: With the fall transition just about to happen, JP finds the fishing very tough as the bass are still in transition.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: With the drought ending and rain headed their way, the crew hunts the final days of the first split in Bayou Black with new friends Jesse Griffiths and Dirk Sorrells.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners

programme.title: Captain's Log

programme.title: Captain's Log

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: It's a trip out to God's Grocery Store with country star Styles Haury ashe and Brandon look for Tuna and Snapper to bring home to the family.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon Simmons is passionate about catching the mighty Sailfish, andgoes out with his tournament partner and former MLB star, Doug Mankietwicz. Doug has won a World Series and Olympic Gold medal, and now is in search of some Sails.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Will Cooper finally trades 3 years of tough times for triumph in his quest to tag an out-of-state buck with a bow.

programme.title: Global Getaway

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt Justin Leake and Meredith McCord divert attention from whats not happening with the tarpon bite to using CoastMaster, light tackle and experience to find snapper success on heavily fished public spots.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When the Bay Point Billfish Open returns, we hop on board the Ellie B for some offshore competition and follow the events epic dockside party.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt Justin & Merediths beautiful Panama City Beach morning is met with a slack tide so a new path to redfish success is found under a popular bridge.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: If you had a blank check to build the best fishing boat possible, what would you create? Capt. Justin gets his wish, but it doesnt come quickly or easily.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Last year was chaotic but it wouldnt be right if we didnt try to throw a wrench into our plans once again. Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to the Dirty Bird.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy and Cody are back on the Raven in Missouri and with opening day of bow season fast approaching they are scrambling to get all the final prep work done and correct any mistakes they might have made along the way.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With a laundry list of things to do on the Dirty Bird, Randy finds himself in a pickle when Cody just up and disappears.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With two weeks until the opener of Missouri archery season, Randy and Cody are trying to do everything they can to have the Raven prepped for the first bow camp.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With bow camp starting off strong at the Dirty Bird, Randy is feeling good about the rest of the week. Until Cody decides to head into town and places a small wager with a stranger.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy and Cody are all hands-on deck at the Raven. Things are coming down to the wire with bow season just around the corner. With just over a week left they are trying to get everything wrapped up before the first bow camp.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh takes his friend Isaiah to the blue water as they look for destin's latest hot bite, the blackfin tuna.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh and George from Two Georges Marina battle the wind and tide on a tough day of fishing which leads Josh to fish another day, solely for revenge on the Sheepshead!

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Join Captain Josh and Sheriff Eric Aden for a day of fishing and fun in Destin, Florida. These two friends hit the water, catching fish both offshore and inshore, and reeling in some impressive catches. With plenty of laughs, great stories, and a few surprises along the way, this episode is all about the joy of fishing and the bond between two guys who love the sea.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Fishing with the Mayor Description: Join the Major of destin as he ventures into the world of coastal fishing, leaving the city behind for a day of fun and unexpected challenges. With plenty of laughs and surprising twists, this episode showcases the Mayor in a whole new light.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With the local Key West ship wrecks covered in Permit, Rush takes good friend and marine artist KC Scott fishing for "inspiration." While permit is the plan, the boys stay rigged and ready for the numerous species the Florida Keys may deliver when fishing offshore.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The most important fish catch is the one that got you hooked on fishing in the first place, and for many of us that catch happened early in life. On this episode Ali and Rush grab their favorite little fishing buddies for a great day on the water on their respective coasts. In Florida, Rush spends time with his son Kade fishing for huge permit while Ali takes his nephew Duke out for some wholesome yellowtail action in California.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As the SoCal Bluefin Tuna fishing season begins to take shape, Ali and Rush head out to fish the waters of San Diego and see what new surprises may be in store for them this year. For many boats in the fleet, the heading turns to the south for a visit to the commercial tuna pen operation that often attracts other fish from miles away. It's parking lot fishing at its best, but with a change in technique and break from the crowd Ali puts Rush on the bite!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing and the marine industry, we are often more united by the Bluefin tuna than we think. For Ali Hussainy, the Bluefin is responsible for fueling his life long passion as an angler, and in this episode he gets to share that passion with two friends that have their own ties to the species. For wildlife biologist Forrest Galante and master sushi chef Hiroyuki Terada, catching a bluefin tuna on rod and reel will be a first!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew heads to Catalina Island off the coast of Southern California to participate in the 2024 War Heroes On Water tournament. This event offers a unique opportunity for the sport fishing community to create meaningful connections with our nation's heroes while raising awareness of the challenges they sometimes face when transitioning back to civilian life. With a little bit of luck and a lot of teamwork, Ali and Rush hope to put their veterans on a Bluefin tuna bite they won't forget!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush takes up an invite from good friend and fellow guide Jared Cyr to sight fish for barracuda and bonefish in the shallow waters of the Florida Keys. Meanwhile Rush's boat takes a break from charter fishing to get a new Seakeeper RIDE system installed.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor meet up with Captain Nick LaBadie at Big Pine Key for an action packed day on the flats chasing tarpon, bonefish and permit for the elusive grand slam.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Retired army nurse Linda Powel wins a dream hunt in Texas hosted by Record Rack Deer feed. What's the catch? Linda has never hunted a day in her life!

programme.title: Modern Hunter

programme.title: Modern Hunter

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: his week, I welcome back Capt. Neill Holland of Ocean Aid 360! Ocean Aid 360 along with Reef Relief, Surfrider, CCA, Beach Weekend, FWC, and NOAA, are leading a THREE DAY marine debris cleanup event that spans four hours each day, featuring daily raffle prizes, free lunches, and swag bags. They are inviting walkers, boaters, kayakers, and paddlers to join forces for a much-needed cleanup of the area. You can participate for one day or all three! Not only will you have a chance to WIN major prizes through daily raffles, but you'll also be contributing to the preservation of marine habitats and wildlife.The event starts 9/13/23 and ends 9/15/23. You can learn more and join this clean up here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/key-haven-coastal-community-cleanup-tickets-709576130307?aff=ebdsoporgprofileAt Ocean Aid 360, the belief is clear: environmental preservation and the livelihoods of marine-dependent communities are inseparable. Captain Neill Holland, a St. Pete, Florida native with a rich background in marine conservation, shares his journey from a career at National Geographic magazine to leading this impactful non-profit.Tune in to gain insights into the remarkable work of Ocean Aid 360 and Captain Neill Holland's dedication to the preservation of our marine ecosystems. It's an episode filled with hope, innovation, and a shared vision of a brighter future for our oceans.Follow Capt Neill on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/gofishtampabay/Follow OCEAN AID 360 on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/oceanaid360https://www.oceanaid360.orghttps://www.gofishtampabay.com#MarineConservation #OceanAid360 #MarineDebrisCleanup #CommunityCleanup #CleanOceans #EnvironmentalStewardship #MarineHabitat #VolunteerForChange #SaveOurSeas #EcoFriendly #WildlifeProtection #SustainableLiving #ProtectTheOcean #RafflePrizes #BeachCleanup #ConservationHeroes #EnvironmentalPartnerships #OceanProtection #CoastalCleanup #CleanerOceans #TeamSeasWEBSITES:http://www.saltwaterexperience.comhttp://www.tomrowlandpodcast.comSTREAM ALL OUR FULL SEASONS ON WAYPOINT TV: http://waypointtv.com/#!/saltwaterexperience

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Throughout the season we get a lot of footage that never makes it on the show and isn't enough for a whole episode, so we put it together here in Bits & Bites.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryans passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh and George from Two Georges Marina battle the wind and tide on a tough day of fishing which leads Josh to fish another day, solely for revenge on the Sheepshead!

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Join Captain Josh and Sheriff Eric Aden for a day of fishing and fun in Destin, Florida. These two friends hit the water, catching fish both offshore and inshore, and reeling in some impressive catches. With plenty of laughs, great stories, and a few surprises along the way, this episode is all about the joy of fishing and the bond between two guys who love the sea.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Fishing with the Mayor Description: Join the Major of destin as he ventures into the world of coastal fishing, leaving the city behind for a day of fun and unexpected challenges. With plenty of laughs and surprising twists, this episode showcases the Mayor in a whole new light.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With the local Key West ship wrecks covered in Permit, Rush takes good friend and marine artist KC Scott fishing for "inspiration." While permit is the plan, the boys stay rigged and ready for the numerous species the Florida Keys may deliver when fishing offshore.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The most important fish catch is the one that got you hooked on fishing in the first place, and for many of us that catch happened early in life. On this episode Ali and Rush grab their favorite little fishing buddies for a great day on the water on their respective coasts. In Florida, Rush spends time with his son Kade fishing for huge permit while Ali takes his nephew Duke out for some wholesome yellowtail action in California.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As the SoCal Bluefin Tuna fishing season begins to take shape, Ali and Rush head out to fish the waters of San Diego and see what new surprises may be in store for them this year. For many boats in the fleet, the heading turns to the south for a visit to the commercial tuna pen operation that often attracts other fish from miles away. It's parking lot fishing at its best, but with a change in technique and break from the crowd Ali puts Rush on the bite!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing and the marine industry, we are often more united by the Bluefin tuna than we think. For Ali Hussainy, the Bluefin is responsible for fueling his life long passion as an angler, and in this episode he gets to share that passion with two friends that have their own ties to the species. For wildlife biologist Forrest Galante and master sushi chef Hiroyuki Terada, catching a bluefin tuna on rod and reel will be a first!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew heads to Catalina Island off the coast of Southern California to participate in the 2024 War Heroes On Water tournament. This event offers a unique opportunity for the sport fishing community to create meaningful connections with our nation's heroes while raising awareness of the challenges they sometimes face when transitioning back to civilian life. With a little bit of luck and a lot of teamwork, Ali and Rush hope to put their veterans on a Bluefin tuna bite they won't forget!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush takes up an invite from good friend and fellow guide Jared Cyr to sight fish for barracuda and bonefish in the shallow waters of the Florida Keys. Meanwhile Rush's boat takes a break from charter fishing to get a new Seakeeper RIDE system installed.

programme.desc: After their father passes away, two privileged Beverly Hills young women are forced to move in with their estranged aunt in East Los Angeles.

programme.title: Before We Go
programme.desc: The lives of two strangers are changed forever after a young woman and man cross paths at Grand Central Station and spend the night together in NYC.

programme.title: Dirty Dancing
programme.desc: Set in the early 1960s, a summer love affair between a nave 17-year-old girl and a charismatic dance instructor at a Catskills hotel highlights the class divide.

programme.title: Dirty Dancing: Havana Nights

programme.title: Suburban Commando

programme.title: Charlotte Gray

programme.title: American Flyers

programme.title: Corrina, Corrina

programme.title: Curly Sue

programme.title: Home Fries

programme.title: Hot to Trot

programme.desc: Join the Ninja brothers for a rollercoaster ride of fun and action, as they witness the kidnapping of a TV superstar and strike back with a vengeance.

programme.title: Hart to Hart Returns
programme.desc: Based on the 1979-'84 TV series.

programme.title: Harriet Craig

programme.title: Duffy

programme.desc: Dancers prepare for a TV special on the twist in this musical featuring performances of chart-topping hits from the heyday of rock 'n' roll.

programme.desc: In this stylish spy thriller, a Londoner working in British Intelligence, Alexander Eberlin, turns out to be a Russian counter-espionage agent.

programme.title: The Notorious Landlady

programme.title: The Whole Truth

programme.desc: Johnny (Cary Grant) seems like a solid match for Julia (Doris Nolan), the socialite daughter of Edward Seton (Henry Kolker). Assured that Johnny is a worthy suitor, Edward approves of the pairing. But, as Johnny's wanderlust surfaces -- he is more interested in traveling than in business -- Edward starts to have doubts. Johnny also begins to wonder if he might not be a better match for Linda (Katharine Hepburn), Julia's outspoken younger sister, with whom he has much more in common.

programme.title: The War Lover
programme.desc: In England during World War II, a pair of bomber pilots fall for the same woman but only one will make it through the conflict to ask for her hand.

programme.title: The Long Gray Line
programme.desc: An Irish immigrant who found a home in the Army as a West Point instructor becomes very close to his pupils, one of whom is Dwight Eisenhower.

programme.desc: Based on a play by S.N. Behrman.

programme.title: Hook, Line and Sinker

programme.title: Dead Reckoning

programme.title: Two-Fisted Law
programme.desc: After Tim Clark's ranch is stolen by Bob Russell, he discovers that the crook is also trying to cheat his lover out of her land.

programme.title: Man in the Saddle
programme.desc: A wounded rancher (Randolph Scott) hides with a schoolmarm (Ellen Drew) after his ex-girlfriend's husband (Alexander Knox) runs him out of town.

programme.title: The Kid From Broken Gun
programme.desc: After years on the East Coast, former boxer Jack Mahoney (Jack Mahoney) returns to New Mexico and finds himself framed for murder. Though the only evidence is circumstantial, in the face of vicious prosecutor Kiefer (Myron Healey), Mahoney's girlfriend -- defense lawyer Gail Kingston (Angela Stevens) -- fails to convince the jury of his innocence. Determined to clear Mahoney's name, postal worker Steve Reynolds (Charles Starrett) transforms himself into the masked rider known as the Durango Kid.

programme.title: The Violent Men
programme.desc: Former Union soldier John Parrish (Glenn Ford) wants to sell his ranch and start a new life by settling down out east. However, the ruthless tactics of Lew Wilkison (Edward G. Robinson), the scheming businessman interested in his property, make Parrish reconsider the move, especially after one of his ranch hands is murdered. Adding to the increasingly tense conflict is Wilkison's wife, Martha (Barbara Stanwyck), who is cheating on her husband with his brother, Cole (Brian Keith).

programme.title: Ambush at Tomahawk Gap
programme.desc: Flaming arrows stop four ex-convicts searching a ghost town for their buried loot.

programme.title: Utah Blaine
programme.desc: A gunfighter helps a ranch owner in his attempt to prevent a renegade crew from taking over the territory.

programme.title: Good Day for a Hanging
programme.desc: When the local sheriff is killed after a bank robbery, ex-lawman Ben Cutler (Fred MacMurray) collars the apparent killer, Eddie Campbell (Robert Vaughn). Because of his background as a local youth who spent time living with the Cutlers, Eddie gets the benefit of the doubt from Ben's daughter and his wife-to-be, Ruth (Margaret Hayes). Ben is firm in his belief that Eddie is guilty, and as the matter is debated in a divisive court battle, it will soon become clear whether or not he's right.

programme.title: The Range Feud
programme.desc: When a murder occurs during a range war, a sheriff (Buck Jones) investigates to clear an innocent man (John Wayne).

programme.title: Dirty Little Billy
programme.desc: After his family moves to a frontier town in Kansas, city-bred teenager Billy Bonney (Michael J. Pollard) finds he has no appetite for farming. He runs away, taking up with local outlaw Goldie (Richard Evans), who operates a saloon in town with the help of a prostitute named Berle (Lee Purcell). The three form a gang of sorts, menacing the locals until the townsfolk collectively decide to drive the outlaws away. Bonney escapes and begins the life of crime that makes him famous as Billy the Kid.

programme.title: Terror Trail
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) heads off a range war over cattle and sheep.

programme.title: Gunman's Walk
programme.desc: Rancher Lee Hackett (Van Heflin) spends so much time trying to keep the violent streak of his son Ed (Tab Hunter) in check, he neglects the needs of his other son Davy (James Darren). When Ed's temper results in the death of an innocent Native American, Lee tries his best to cover his son's tracks by making a deal with unscrupulous horse trader Jensen (Ray Teal), who falsely testifies on Ed's behalf. But it becomes clear that Ed can't change, and a shootout between father and son ensues.

programme.title: The Hellions
programme.desc: A small-town policeman (Richard Todd) stands alone against a family of outlaws in 19th-century South Africa.

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma
programme.desc: Dan Evans (Van Heflin), a drought-plagued Arizona rancher, volunteers to take captured stagecoach robber and murderer Ben Wade (Glenn Ford) from Bisbee to Contention City, where the criminal will be put aboard the 3:10 train to Yuma for his trial. Accompanied only by the town drunk, Alex Potter (Henry Jones), Dan battles Wade's henchman (Richard Jaeckel), the murder victim's revenge-minded brother, and the temptation of the large bribe Wade offers in exchange for his freedom.

programme.title: 40 Guns to Apache Pass
programme.desc: A cavalry captain (Audie Murphy) rescues settlers and catches a corporal (Kenneth Tobey) selling rifles to Apaches.

programme.title: Al Jennings of Oklahoma
programme.desc: Lawyer Al (Dan Duryea) and brother Frank (Dick Foran) turn to robbing banks and trains after Union troops raid their home.

programme.title: Saddles and Sagebrush
programme.desc: A rancher (Russell Hayden) joins an outlaw gang to figure out how to stop it.

programme.title: Rockin' in the Rockies
programme.desc: Shorty Williams (Moe Howard) is put in charge of his cousin's ranch, but he is more concerned with becoming a prospector. He comes across two drifters (Larry Fine, Curly Howard) who just got lucky at the roulette table and befriends them as possible investors. Shorty also meets singer Betty (Gladys Blake) and her partner (Mary Beth Hughes) and convinces them to stay on the ranch along with the vagrants. Unfortunately, Shorty's cousin, Rusty (Jay Kirby), returns early and isn't pleased.

programme.title: Alvarez Kelly
programme.desc: Alvarez Kelly (William Holden) is a Mexican cattle rancher who is doing his best to stay out of the Civil War. He has no interest in which side may win or lose -- Kelly is far more concerned about his own survival, and about making money. He soon finds himself in the middle of the conflict, however, when a confederate colonel (Richard Widmark) captures the rancher and forces Kelly to help his soldiers steal a nearby herd of cattle, which they desperately need for food.

programme.title: Phantom Stagecoach
programme.desc: A dispute between stage lines ends with a steel-armored stagecoach.

programme.title: The Desperados
programme.desc: A family of Confederate guerrillas continues to kill long after the Civil War has ended. One of the sons breaks with the family to make a new life.

programme.title: Ridin' for Justice
programme.desc: A popular cowboy (Buck Jones) takes the blame for the death of a deputy who tried to force himself on the marshal's wife.

programme.title: The Rough, Tough West
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) looks for his friend Big Jack (Jack Mahoney) and finds out that Jack is illegally commandeering the mines and claims of others.

programme.title: Banjo Hackett

programme.title: Two-Fisted Law

However, Benson was suspiciously absent at the time of the battle and is now despised by the troops. So when an order to retrieve the bodies from the battlefield arrives, Benson volunteers for the dangerous mission of returning back into Indian territory.
