programme.desc: The Falcon investigates the mysterious disappearance of three men and $100,000 from a cross-country airliner.

programme.title: The Falcon in Hollywood
programme.desc: A vacation turns out to be anything but relaxing for The Falcon when an actor is found murdered on the set of a jinxed movie shoot.

programme.title: The Falcon in Mexico
programme.desc: Tom Lawrence hunts an assassin targeting him and a gallery owner's daughter, with help from a witty Mexican cab driver, as bodies pile up.

programme.title: The Falcon Strikes Back
programme.desc: Tom Lawrence finds Mia Bruger, who framed him, dead, uncovering a vast scheme of stolen war bonds in the process.

programme.title: The Falcon's Brother
programme.desc: When a debonair P.I. with a crime-fighting alter ego is shot, his brother assumes the disguise in a case involving Nazi espionage and assassination.

programme.title: Three Sailors and a Girl
programme.desc: Gordon MacRae, Gene Nelson, Jack E. Leonard, and Jane Powell star in one of the greatest movie musicals ever!

programme.title: The Super Cops
programme.desc: Two New York cops are sent to a crime-ridden section of Brooklyn, where they develop their own bizarre and amusingly extreme methods of fighting.

programme.title: Room Service
programme.desc: Deep in debt, a producer and his team fake a measles outbreak and a suicide in a wild bid to secure backing for their Broadway play.

programme.title: Skirts Ahoy!
programme.desc: After a series of romantic setbacks, three determined women join the Navy, defying strict rules in a bold quest to find eligible men.

programme.title: The Outfit
programme.desc: After unknowingly robbing a syndicate bank, an ex-con demands $250,000 from the mob to avenge his brother's death in a dangerous quest for justice.

programme.title: The Master of Ballantrae
programme.desc: After a rebellion defeat, a man escapes to the West Indies, rebuilding his fortune. Upon return, he finds his beloved engaged to his brother.

programme.title: Lovely to Look At
programme.desc: Three young men find a bankroll for their Broadway show after one of them suddenly inherits a fashion salon.

programme.title: Manpower
programme.desc: Two best friends get tangled up in jealousy and betrayal after they both fall for the same nightclub hostess.

programme.title: A Damsel in Distress
programme.desc: While performing in London, Jerry (Fred Astaire) is "elected" by Lord Marshmorton to rescue his daughter.

programme.title: The Devil's Brother
programme.desc: Laurel and Hardy bumble their way into the heart of a classic comic opera filled with fearsome bandits.

programme.title: So Big (1954)
programme.desc: The story of a widowed mother's great love and devotion for her only son.

programme.title: Ben-Hur (1959)
programme.desc: The epic life of a Jewish man who is unjustly enslaved yet rises to greatness in Rome.

programme.title: Ocean's Eleven (1960)
programme.desc: Eleven pals prepare to rob five Las Vegas casinos on New Year's Eve.

programme.title: The Music Man
programme.desc: After convincing Iowa townsfolk to invest in a boys' marching band, a traveling con man's scheme is complicated by his feelings for a local librarian.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team goes on a manhunt when one of its own is killed; a team member must choose which one of their kidnapped loved ones will survive.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Following the murder of an important family member, the team searches for Delano and Wo Fat.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett asks Catherine to help find his mother; the teams seek assistance from August March (Edward Asner) with a deadly art heist.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Danny and McGarrett's day at sea takes a deadly turn when their boat is hijacked.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team's investigation into the death of a young woman, killed after being auctioned off at a charity event, leads to a plot that could put the entire city in jeopardy.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: When a Marine recruiter is murdered, the team delves into the world of military enlistment to try to find the killer; Natalia must face her ex-husband when he asks out one of her co-workers.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team must find a suspected terrorist, who goes on the run after a failed attempt on her life.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio, the lab's night shift and Calleigh's ex-boyfriend must find evidence that proves Natalia's innocence when she is accused of her ex-husband's murder.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio and the bomb squad must defuse a land mine before it detonates; Delko is sued for his role in a domestic dispute.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Hijackers take a truck full of confiscated weapons, and Horatio links the crime to Clavo Cruz; a confiscated missile launched into the courthouse helps Clavo escape; a member of Horatio's team is fatally shot.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A member of the team fights for his life after being shot in the head; the hunt for Clavo Cruz continues.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team investigates when the parents of a baby sitter in an upscale neighborhood are murdered; key evidence leads Horatio to expose a doctor who has dirty secrets.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: An extremely intelligent Navy coder -- employed by Brody's mom (Annie Potts) -- is put in danger when the heart intended for him is stolen.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: After traveling to Texas to escort a key witness to the trial of an infamous arms dealer, Sonja and Special Agent Pride are ambushed.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: During a blackout in New Orleans, Pride is determined to figure out who murdered a family friend's fiance.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A Marine's murder reveals new clues in the first case LaSalle and Pride worked together; a Thanksgiving celebration at Pride's bar.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Wade's adopted son becomes a suspect after a series of Christmas burglaries turn deadly; Brody and LaSalle tease Sonja about the team's holiday gift exchange.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Special Agent Pride and the team investigate a Russian sleeper agent involved with Abby's brother; Sebastian goes to Washington, D.C., to work with Abby; Bishop drives all night to deliver a package and help the New Orleans team.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The staged suicide of a petty officer turns out to be murder; the team secretly works on an online dating profile for Pride.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A Mardi Gras celebration at Pride's bar is cut short when he and Mayor Douglas Hamilton (Steven Weber) are abducted by unknown assailants.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Evidence suggests that the man responsible for saving a lieutenant's life is a soldier who was captured in Afghanistan.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Special Agent Pride and the team uncover a domestic drug ring -- led by Sonja's childhood friend, Marion Watkins (Samaire Armstrong), that is producing cocaine.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A Navy captain is murdered during an appearance on a local radio show; Pride's daughter comes home to talk about her plans for the future.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Agent Brody sees a connection between the case of a sailor struck by a party bus and the death of her sister; the team gets ready for the city's St. Patrick's Day celebrations.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: After Pride's daughter is attacked on campus, the team finds a surveillance van loaded with pictures of the special agent's every move.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team investigates when a Navy lieutenant is murdered during a traditional funeral procession in the French Quarter honoring the recently deceased.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When a Navy lieutenant dies during a secret visit to a general's hotel, agent Pride and the team are asked to break protocol for the investigation.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: While visiting her family's restaurant in the French Quarter, a Navy culinary specialist is the target of an explosion; in D.C., Brody tracks a lead in the Gen. Leak case.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When MATTHEW DRAPER, a quarry worker is killed by a demolition charge after obeying the orders of his foreman, IAN FRASER, to return to the unexploded device, no one can predict how it might effect the tranquil village of Fletcher's Cross nine years later...

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby's aunt, Alice Bly (Phyllis Calvert), has an addiction to detective stories, a deep admiration for her favourite nephew, and is recovering from an operation at the Lawnside Nursing Home. When a resident dies, Alice Bly picks up gossip which, mixed with the detective fiction with which she is passing the hours, makes her think that all is not as it should be at Lawnside.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The village of Midsomer Mallow is one of the villages hoping to win the title of the "Perfect English Village" competition. As the story unfolds, not everything is "perfect" as local thief Peter Drinkwater is stabbed with a pitchfork at an abandoned farm, he's using as a squat. Shortly after robbing a retired actor's home. Despite the villagers' best efforts to keep the murder quiet so as to not ruin their chances in the competition, several further deaths occur eventually bringing Detective Chief Inspector Barnaby back several decades to uncover the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Cully's latest boyfriend, Nico, decides to shadow Troy in preparation for a TV role he recently got, but gets more hands-on experience than he expected when investigations into a slashed painting at a museum in Aspern Tallow, a 17th century portrait of Royalist Jonathan Lowrie, are overshadowed by the murder of his descendant, Marcus Lowrie. It isn't long before Barnaby and Troy, with Nico's assistance, find themselves dealing with mysterious, ghostly events, escaped criminals, and a museum trustee who has more to them than meets the eye.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A wealthy family uses their power and influence to distance themselves from a rape and murder investigation.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A priest is shot to death in his church rectory; Horatio and Delko examine the charred remain of a pregnant woman.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio and the team investigate the murder of a 5-year-old girl in a restaurant washroom.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Evidence on a lost, blood-soaked toddler leads the CSI team to her home where each family member's spilled blood tells a tale of horror. Wanda De Jesus guest stars.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team tries to get inside the mind of a sniper after three people are shot and killed in downtown Miami.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio and the team investigate after the corpse of an unidentified girl is found near an extremely strict rehabilitation camp.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio investigates the stabbing death of a prostitute who is found stuffed under a bed in a hotel room.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio and Speedle investigate the manufacture of lethal drugs at mobile labs; an elderly woman is murdered at a senior citizen home.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A serial rapist is found dead of suffocation; investigators probe the murders of a crematorium owner and a girl found behind the crematorium.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Team members meet an environmental lawyer who has radiation poisoning after they are exposed to radiation during an investigation.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When the curate of the local church in Midsomer Parva is burned alive in the effigy of the straw woman, DCI Tom Barnaby and DS Dan Scott find themselves investigating what must be a murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Exactly nine years after Ferdy Villers killed himself, his entire family reunites for Christmas unaware that someone is out for revenge.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The closing of what was once a very popular public garden in Midsomer Deverell sparks a series of murders that have Inspector Barnaby and Sgt. Troy stumped.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Following the funeral of local hotelier Karl Wainwright, his hotel's manager and a well liked Punch and Judy performer, Gregory Chambers, disappears unusually in yet another picturesque Midsomer village. Most people dismiss his disappearance completely but when he doesn't turn up, a search is conducted and a severed hand, confirmed to be Gregory's, turns up in the woods. Further deaths and a mushroom poisoning occur surrounding the beneficiaries of Karl Wainwright's will. All is not as it seems.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A man's naked body found under mysterious circumstances, within a crop circle on Sir Harry Chatwyn's wheat field, leads police to investigating how he wound up in the field after being electrocuted. While the nearby village of Midsomer Parva is abuzz with UFO mania, Barnaby is unconvinced by a local ufologist that the man's death was the result of alien activity, as he uncovers rivalries, theft and hatred during his investigations, soon after a well known burglar is found dead in another crop circle with identical injuries.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Returning home one night, in a drunken state, the local doctor of Newton Magna calls in the police after he had accidentally hit a man, yet when Barnaby and Troy arrive, the injured man is nowhere to be found. As they investigate the mystery, Barnaby encounters an old adversary who is working to help renovate the village and whose daughter is getting married to a local boy. Matters soon become complicated, when the body of the best man's father is found in a well that was being renovated, whom the detectives soon discover had disappeared on the day he was planning to run away with a local farmer's wife.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Dave Cutler, Goodman's Land's amorous postman, is found almost decapitated near the common early one morning. Newspaper girl Holly Reid (Kate Maberly) tells Barnaby that she heard music playing faintly nearby. Barnaby and Troy are aided in their investigations by local WPC Jay Nash (Gillian Kearney).

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: After a local photographer wins an urban myth competition with his creation of The Wolf Hunter, it unexpectedly gains a cult following. However, when a man is killed, Barnaby and Winter must investigate if this myth has become murderous reality.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A local outcast, who was controversially acquitted of murder years earlier, is the latest inductee into a post-operative heart rehab club. Following his arrival, members' dreams of a second chance at life begin to be cut short.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As the owners of Karras Games gather for a murder mystery weekend, the immersive experience takes a puzzling twist when a killer strikes for real. The police's detective skills are put to the test as they are forced to solve this case on their own.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The annual Midsomer Scarecrow Festival takes a grisly turn as bodies begin appearing on poles displayed alongside their straw creations; the investigation reveals rivalries that run deep and shows people will do just about anything to win.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Midsomer Mummers, an amateur operatic society, rehearses for its charity concert when the body of an unknown man is found in the theatre; the investigation quickly becomes a race to discover who is desperate to take centre stage.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Each year, the village of Angel's Rise hosts the Psychic Fayre. Founded by the Saint-Stephens family in memory of their late daughter, the event attracts mediums, psychics and followers of the occult. When a body is found surrounded by ritual symbols on the eve of the festival, Barnaby must step into the spiritual world to find the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The appearance of a headless horseman at Quitewell Hall foreshadows a number of deaths amongst an aristocratic family. In the midst of a Civil War re-enactment the family relive their own historic battles with their hostile neighbours. But what is the truth about the DeQuettevilles - and the ghostly rider?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a barrister is killed in Midsomer, suspicion falls on convicted murderer Grady Felton. Grady has just returned to the village where he committed the murder years ago amid much anger from locals. But Grady has a solid alibi. Barnaby suspects he is working with an accomplice - until Grady himself is targeted in an arson attack.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The murder of a journalist has chilling echoes of a 1960s horror film starring Midsomer's own Stella Harris. When Stella's more famous sister returns after a 40-year family rift, the killings escalate, each of them reminiscent of a movie plot. Is life - and death - imitating art?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As darkness covers Midsomer Stanton during a total eclipse of the sun, amateur astronomer Jeremy Harper is killed by a blow to the head with a meteorite. Barnaby and Jones soon discover intrigue, sexual tension and academic rivalry are rife among the star-seeking community.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Harriet Farmer wakes up after being in a coma since the night she tried to elope. Soon afterwards, a killer strikes members of a chess club. Could the attack which left Harriet for dead a year ago be linked to moves on a chess board? And where is her boyfriend Finn?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A woman is crushed to death with a giant round of cheese at the home of the world-famous Midsomer Blue. Secret and controversial plans to modernise the dairy are revealed while rumours about private lives of the parents cause a row at the prestigious local prep school. As other people linked to the dairy meet agonising deaths, long-held secrets start to emerge...

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: No one could suspect that a prestigious golf club would be the setting for murder, but when one of the major members is found dead, bludgeoned to death in a thicket next to the 13th hole, Barnaby and Jones try to determine what made him leave the fairway. It seems the club has a rift between the snobbish members, and local villagers, the latter only allowed onto the course for a few hours a week. Before long, another member turns up dead, and the detectives soon find the club has a hidden history, involving gambling, illegal money lending and assault, prompting the pair to determine if a club member, or one of its staff, is responsible for the deeds.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A newly discovered masterpiece by landscape artist Henry Hogson causes a stir when it is auctioned for 400,000 - just hours before its former owner is tortured and killed. When another Hogson is stolen, Barnaby decides to become an expert on the Midsomer painter, with the help of art teacher Matilda Simms (Susannah Harker). He soon realises the paintings are not what they seem - but the death toll is rising.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Former secret agent Geoffrey Larkin arrives in Midsomer Parva and stays at Allenby House, a country mansion run by former spies Sir Malcolm Frazer (Benjamin Whitrow), his son Nicky (Peter Davison) and Nicky's wife Jenny (Alice Krige) as a safe house. Geoffrey is soon gashed to death after a cricket match in Midsomer Parva, and the locals blame the 'beast of Midsomer'. However, Barnaby - a former spy himself - soon realises that the killing has links to Allenby House and Cold War Berlin, but is initially thrown off the case by MI6. But when a further murder occurs MI6 Agent Glen Jarvis (Neil Stuke) asks Barnaby back on the case.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Midsomer University science fellow and cycling enthusiast George Jeffers (David Haig) threatens to make public a problem with his state-of-the-art invention Kernel Logic, but American software boss Clinton Finn fears he will lose millions if the truth comes out. When a schoolteacher is killed in a hit-and-run, Barnaby suspects Jeffers was the intended target. The subsequent murder of a fellow cyclist (Philip Jackson) brings the involvement of fellow University associates (Jonathan Cecil and Jim Norton) into sharper focus.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the peaceful village of Little Worthy, Bob Moss was about to open up his beloved model village, when he found a gruesome extra attraction. Young local, Richard Tanner, had been stabbed in the side and his corpse tied down like Gulliver in Lilliput. Barnaby and Jones wonder who wanted him dead, but when the woman he was secretly meeting is killed during the village's Crazy Craft race, the pair have to delve in and discover who might be lying and hiding secrets.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A cat burglar is on the loose, one known as "the Creeper", but the wave of burglaries he or she have committed, seem to have finally led to murder, when David Roper (Rik Mayall) is found smothered in his bed on the Chettham family estate. Yet Barnaby and Jones learn he may have been planning to write a book that could have been quite uncomfortable for someone, leading the pair to determine whether members of the Chettham family, or their friends, were responsible.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A sleep-walking school teacher (Nancy Carroll) starts to believe she has slit the throats of her mentor (Tim Wylton) and a local handyman man in her sleep, but her friends (Paola Dionisotti and Monica Dolan) are not convinced that she is the culprit, nor is Barnaby. A local philanthropist (Paul Chapman) and his social-climbing wife (Suzanne Burden) are planning the annual Frobisher night - but will it go without a hitch, and can they identify the killer?

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: It's all hands on deck when Danny and the crew discover a truckload of unpleasant surprises hiding in a 1960 Cadillac Coupe de Ville that the client wants turned into a show car.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny and the crew are faced with a monumental task when they take on a botched restoration job on a 1968 Oldsmobile Cutlass.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: It's all hands on deck when a simple paint job on a 1964 Corvette turns into a full on restoration.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Another day at the Barrett-Jackson auction provides buyers of all budgets and interests with lots of choices, such as as restorations, moderns, customs, trucks and more.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Examples from the American muscle era cross the block in Las Vegas, pushing prices way up, including a VIN001 Mercury Cougar; bidders need all the luck they can muster to snare the car of their dreams.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The attention shifts to American-made rides as an incredible selection of Dodges, Chevrolets, and Fords crosses the auction block, with options ranging from a 1939 Ford Custom Roadster to a 1956 Ford Thunderbird Convertible.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: As the Barrett-Jackson Auction gets into full swing, the auction block sees a surge of American Made cars. Everything from Chevy Corvettes to Ford Mustang Mach 1s, and even a 1927 Ford Model-T Popcorn Truck cross the auction block!

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: A cavalcade of American muscle cars, including Pontiac GTs, Corvettes, Hemi Challengers, Baracudas, Oldsmobiles, Chevelles, crosses the auction block.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The 'Stangs take on the 'Vettes with examples from across all eras, and a few Thunderbirds and Plymouths thrown in for good measure.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Collector cars roll down the block at this year's Barrett-Jackson Palm Beach auction; Barrett-Jackson lands in Palm Beach, Fla.

programme.desc: The attention shifts to American-made rides as an incredible selection of Dodges, Chevrolets, and Fords crosses the auction block, with options ranging from a 1939 Ford Custom Roadster to a 1956 Ford Thunderbird Convertible.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: As the Barrett-Jackson Auction gets into full swing, the auction block sees a surge of American Made cars. Everything from Chevy Corvettes to Ford Mustang Mach 1s, and even a 1927 Ford Model-T Popcorn Truck cross the auction block!

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: A cavalcade of American muscle cars, including Pontiac GTs, Corvettes, Hemi Challengers, Baracudas, Oldsmobiles, Chevelles, crosses the auction block.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The 'Stangs take on the 'Vettes with examples from across all eras, and a few Thunderbirds and Plymouths thrown in for good measure.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Collector cars roll down the block at this year's Barrett-Jackson Palm Beach auction; Barrett-Jackson lands in Palm Beach, Fla.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The bidders battle it out as they try to gain ownership of the one-of-a-kind cars coming across the auction block in Scottsdale, Ariz.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: As Super Saturday continues, the variety of Chevys crossing the auction block reaches a whole new level; from Chevelles to Bel Airs to Corvettes, the options are endless; a Vin1 '22 GMC Hummer EV tops them all and sells for $2.5 million.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The hottest cars are rolling down the block, causing car enthusiast mayhem like never before.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The best of the best are coming across the auction block as Barrett-Jackson celebrates 50 years in Scottsdale, Ariz.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Bidders compete over one of the greatest collections of Ford Shelbys in Barrett-Jackson history, as well as a wide offering of Chevys; Craig Jackson and Steve Davis give an inside look at the 1976 custom Ford wagon, El Chapo.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The collector car hobby has exploded in recent years, with a huge range of vehicles sought after by collectors; Craig Jackson and Steve Davis discuss changes in collector car trends over time as prices climb on the auction block.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby must rely on niece Stephanie and cousin Belinda to do his dirty work; the rigging guys formulate a plan to get rid of DJ; James must cope with his dad's health issues while also leading his crew.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: DJ Jeremiah is pushed to his breaking point; Coatsy boots Joe Linderborg from his seat in the yarder; the Dreadknots find themselves on the wrong end of a falling log; Shelby and his assistants fight to claim the biggest Cypress of the season.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Three years of tension between Craig and DJ comes to a head; the Swamp Man goes on a special mission for his wife; the end of the North Thorn site may mean the end of the season at Papac; the Dreadknots are in the line of fire.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The Swamp Man targets a money log in dangerous territory; DJ gets put on notice; Brad and Swilley struggle to keep S&S from running off the rails.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Gabe faces a crew mutiny; the guys at Lemare put their chaser to the test; Shelby and Belinda take to the open road to bring home a money log; James Smith lashes out against his own crew.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby builds his new empire one big toy at a time; the men of S&S Aqua Logging deal with last week's fallout; DJ suffers an injury that could take him out of the season; a whole new kind of logging.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The Dreadknots come face-to-face with one of the most fearsome creatures in the river; Shelby and Donna put his new paddle barge to work; DJ returns to work but faces another battle with Craig; the Woodchucks push hard to meet their deadline.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby puts his new toys to work and discovers a huge payday in his own backyard; runaway logs send Craig over the edge; Joe and Coatsy strike out on their own; the Woodchucks battle a crumbling wall ; Jimmy Smith says goodbye.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: When Hurricane Isaac hits the bayou, Shelby Stanga must race to save his logging empire; a string of crew meltdowns at Rygaard sends the site into chaos; Brad and Swilley struggle to get S&S back in the Log-Off after losing their captain.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The Swamp Man attempts a daring rescue of his aging relatives from the rising storm waters; the Woodchucks don't make their deadline and their company hangs in the balance; S&S finally hits a honey hole with the help of Swilley's brother.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick and Chum kick it with a rare pair of Pumas from 1968; Chum is blown away by a fan from the 1940s; lab notes by Marie Curie leave Rick glowing; a Post Malone guitar inspires a smashing adventure for the guys.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chum chases a lead on a 1963 Fiat Microcar; a rare musical instrument enters the shop; Rick and Corey make a friendly wager on a set of billiard balls; Rick examines the holy grail of coins.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: When Rick gets his hands on a pretty stellar coin, Corey flips about the astronomical asking price; Chum goes to the mat when an NWA Championship Wrestling belt elbows its way into the shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: An antique circus calliope; Rick deals for a letter signed by JFK; Rick hangs up a painting that offends the guys.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick inspects a painted bedroom door from the childhood home of music icon Jim Morrison; Chumlee looks at a 1988 Legend of Zelda board game; Corey gets a lead on a rare motorcycle collection.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chumlee checks out two classic pinball machines; Rick checks out a carrier pigeon capsule from WWII; Rick takes a ribbing when decides to take up boxing.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Bullet shells from John Dillinger's final robbery get caught in the shop; Rick and Corey attempt to make a drive by deal on a vintage Schwinn Whizzer from 1947.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A self-portrait from Rolling Stones guitarist Ron Wood finds its way into the shop; Rick becomes nostalgic when a stack of love letters letters handwritten by Mickey Rooney are mailed in.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A cast jacket from "Pulp Fiction" arrives in the shop; opera gloves signed by Hollywood legend Clark Gable are brought in; Rick heads to Las Vegas legend Lonnie Hammargren's home to check out his collection.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A gold and silver Remington Arms gun comes into the shop; a collection of Mr.T dolls come into the store.

programme.desc: Lithographs are brought into the shop and they are believed to be from Vincent Van Gogh; a vintage skateboard collection comes in.

programme.desc: A guitar pedal used by Kurt Cobain is brought into the shop; an 1842 Book of Mormon appears to be the most expensive book to ever come through the door.

programme.desc: A mummified falcon finds its way into the shop; an autographed Harlem Globetrotters basketball from 1978 comes in.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie takes a business trip to Scotland to expand his duck call business, he brings the entire family along so they can reconnect with their Scottish roots.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: A special holiday episode of Duck Dynasty shows when the Robertson family took over the Thanksgiving special of a local TV show "Good Morning Arklamiss."

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie becomes the temporary owner of a thoroughbred, he and the guys take it to a local track and enter it into a race.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertsons help a long time employee whose Mom has fallen on hard times by buying her a brand new house for Christmas. Jep, Jase, Martin and Godwin race to finish a deck in time for the big reveal, only to get sidetracked by a hammering competition.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the Robertsons participate in the West Monroe Fire Department pancake breakfast, the firemen invite Willie and his brothers to train with the department for the day.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie contemplates re-branding the Duck Commander image, Jase takes issue with having an outsider design their image.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The guys realize it is time for the annual cleaning of the duck blinds when they come across a gator using one as a home.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Brotherly competition is taken to a whole new level when Jase and Willie challenge Alan and Jep to a survival race through the woods on Phil's property.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Phil discovers more beaver activity on the Robertson land, he recruits Jase, Jep, and Si to get rid of them. Meanwhile, Willie and Korie bring Bella to her first day of karate practice.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Stumped on a way to celebrate Willie's birthday, Korie enlists the guys' help and Jase takes the reigns in planning a trip to the lake where Phil and Kay used to live.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: A compilation of the best scenes from all 11 seasons of A&E's hit series Duck Dynasty.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie takes a business trip to Scotland to expand his duck call business, he brings the entire family along so they can reconnect with their Scottish roots.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: A special holiday episode of Duck Dynasty shows when the Robertson family took over the Thanksgiving special of a local TV show "Good Morning Arklamiss."

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie becomes the temporary owner of a thoroughbred, he and the guys take it to a local track and enter it into a race.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertsons help a long time employee whose Mom has fallen on hard times by buying her a brand new house for Christmas. Jep, Jase, Martin and Godwin race to finish a deck in time for the big reveal, only to get sidetracked by a hammering competition.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase enters an outhouse race to help promote Willie's Duck Diner, but when the Robertsons show up for the race, they face an unexpected rival -- Phillip McMillan. Meanwhile, Willie attempts to create the world's greatest bologna sandwich for his Duck Diner menu, and enlists the help of the ladies to be his "taste testers."

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie helps Sadie with her homework by enlisting the guys to create a real-life version of a math problem, but when Jase and Willie get sidetracked helping Sadie.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jep asks Willie and the guys to help move his old chicken coop into his new house, which is under renovation, Jessica takes issue with its appearance, leading the guys to yet another project.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie becomes an assistant coach on Lil' Will's struggling football team, his authority is tested when the kids challenge the adults to a scrimmage. Meanwhile, Kay brings Jep and Si to an aquarobics class at a local health club.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase and the guys transform an old pontoon boat into a floating duck blind, they are faced with the impending question of whether or not it will actually float. Meanwhile, when Kay's dog Bobo misbehaves, Willie signs Kay and Bobo up for a doggie obedience class.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jep and Jessica move into Willie and Jase's neighborhood, Jep is sidelined with an illness, causing Willie and the Robertson family to pitch in and help Jessica get her new house ready in time for Jep's arrival home.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie and the guys take John Luke golfing prior to his engagement party, their attempts at marital advice don't exactly work out as planned.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase receives a palate of fireworks as a gift, he and the guys create a homemade fireworks display for the Robertson family 4th of July barbeque. Meanwhile, Uncle Si is honored by the veterans association and given his own exhibit at a local military museum.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Phil and Jase get into an argument about which type of duck decoy works best, Jase and the guys repaint some old decoys, betting that Phil cannot tell the difference. Meanwhile, Jessica challenges Willie to a bowling contest with Kay's "Big Sista's" club.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase and the guys discover they have a knack for removing pests from other people's property, they use their new talents to their advantage. Meanwhile, Willie gives Sadie and John Luke summer jobs at his diner, but first he must train them to be good employees.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When an office prank war spirals out of control, Phil volunteers Willie, Jase, and Jep to help Alan at the church, which seems more like a punishment than charity work. Meanwhile, Korie gives Kay a surprise art class taught by famous artist Pierre Matisse.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the guys spend the weekend at a hunting cabin to celebrate Martin's bachelor party, things turns explosive after they find a cache of antique black powder weapons. Meanwhile, Willie helps Kay fulfill her lifelong dream of owning a petting zoo.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Uncle Si has a brush with death, he creates a bucket list and asks the guys to help him fulfill his dreams. Meanwhile, Kay sets out to prove to Willie and Alan that she actually graduated high school.

programme.desc: When Duck Commander sponsors a NASCAR race, Jase and the guys get themselves in the mood by attempting to work as a pit crew. Meanwhile, Willie and Korie challenge John Luke and his fianc Mary Kate to a doubles tennis match.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: In this very special wedding episode, John Luke Robertson is getting married to his fianc Mary Kate, and our cameras are with him every step of the way.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Missy's parents visit, her father convinces Jase to take him on a quail hunt. But while their "bonding hunt" yields very few quail, it does bring them closer together as friends.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Si recruits his nephews to help him transport a storage container to his backyard, but things take a turn when Jep becomes locked inside the box.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie's old rival Phillip McMillan challenges him to a game of dodgeball, Willie recruits his family members to settle a score once and for all.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase and Phil make a bet about whether or not human beings in a duck blind are visible from the air, Jep buys a drone copter to get a "bird's eye" view, but ends up losing it in the process.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase and the guys convince Willie to hire his older brother Alan to work at Duck Commander, but when Alan begins micromanaging everyone, they quickly change their mind.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the Robertsons throw a Renaissance Fair birthday party for Godwin, various family members compete in a tournament to win knighthood.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: In this special episode, the Duck Commander team surprises two wounded veterans with a trip to Monroe so they can be in an episode of Duck Dynasty. To show their support, the Robertson family stages a "color run" to bring awareness to our wounded soldiers.

programme.desc: Willie and Alan agree to help Miss Kay open her own bakery, but things take a turn when it Kay is asked to hand over her secret recipes.

programme.desc: When Missy and Jase's son Reed purchases an old van to boost his music career, his parents begin to question some of his choices.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe gives a '69 GTO his signature twist with rad body mods and more.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe and the crew devise big plans for Amanda's find: A 1971 Karmann Ghia.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe tackles a '62 Impala and money troubles threaten to leave it in limbo.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe and the crew tackle a '67 Chevy Nova.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe comes up with a plan for a '59 Impala that looks like a parts donor.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A 1970 C10 looks more like a truckload of spare parts than a truck.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe runs into trouble trying to rebuild a friend's '55 Chevy Bel Air.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin is excited to see a straight '63 Impala with a four speed and legendary 409 engine under the hood; the owner wants to keep it original with the main mods under the body, new frame, suspension and big wheels.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A new customer, comes into the shop with an exceptional 1963 Cadillac; this car screams luxury but needs an upgrade; with Shane giving the MBC team creative freedom on the build, Joe gets to work on a plan; new engine, new wheels and a new interior.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Return customer Lee Farris comes to Martin Bros with a 1956 Chevy Bel Air, his first car that he wants to bring back to life; the first thing Joe notices is the outdated flame paint job.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe makes a high-risk move and chops the top off of a 1950 Mercury coupe.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: With the 1950 Mercury successfully chopped, the rest of the work can begin; the MBC team now has to marry the old roof with the new geometry of the newly chopped body; there are angles everywhere and they are all out of whack.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin gets some unusual cars coming through the door of his work shop, but when a customer from California arrives with a '63 Rambler wagon and tells Joe he can do what he wants with it, he decides to go to town with a radical custom job.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin loves Novas and his eyes light up when a new customer, Eric, wants him to customize a 1972 as a tribute to his brother, if they can find one; Shag and Amanda hunt down a '71, in what appears to be mint condition.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin and his crew are always under the gun, but their latest build, a '71 Nova, is well behind schedule and they have a ton of work to do; Joe is really going to town on the metal work on this car, inside and out.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: The Martins face the challenge of trying to fit a 6'5" former football player into the cab of a 1967 Chevy C10, requiring customization of the firewall, motor, frame and interior.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Facing deadline, the shop struggles to fit a gigantic ex-NFL player into a tiny 1967 Chevy C10 that includes a customized leather interior and automated bed cover.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe is pushing his engineering chops to the limit by building a monster trike that would look right at home on the set of a "Mad Max" movie.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Shag and Amanda get a '65 Chevy II Nova for a steal, but as the team digs in, rat nests and rust are the least of their worries; the build requires a complete overhaul and has them thinking they bit off more than they can chew.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Fitment issues in the engine bay leave the entire shop scratching their heads; Joe has big plans for the '65 Nova, but a small space to work with.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A customer wants to surprise his wife with major upgrades to her '68 Corvette convertible, but working with the fiberglass body soon brings on headaches that threaten both the car and the shop to crack under the pressure.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: The clock is ticking to complete a 1968 Corvette convertible, but messy fiberglass repairs uncover major collision damage; and if that wasn't enough, the customer also wants an all-white interior, which isn't a good fit for such a dirty job.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A time capsule rolls into the shop in the form of a 1983 Silverado with exactly 69.2 miles on it; the owner recently passed away, and his daughter wants to finish turning his truck into a modern muscle car under the hood.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Amanda and Shag stumble upon a '73 Vega with a rich history and a seller anxious to see his car restored to glory; they plan to chop the top and add a enormous engine, but first they must tackle over 40 years of rust and grime.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin brings new life to old iron at his shop Joe Martin Customs; working with his wife Amanda, and best friend Shag, this custom shop oversees every phase of restoration from design, fabrication and mechanicals, to the final paint job.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A '57 Chevy looks great, but the guys discover that looks can be deceiving.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin puts the finishing touches on the 1957 Chevrolet Bel Air and arranges for the car to be delivered to the owner; Joe uses all his tricks to prepare a Chevrolet C10 for a charity auction with a stylish paint job.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe and the team finish up the '51 Chevy 3100 Christmas-parade truck.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe and the team finish up the '51 Chevy 3100 Christmas-parade truck.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe dusts off his prized '65 Pontiac Catalina to give it the facelift it deserves -- new brakes, new trick frame and a bigger, badder LSA 600 horsepower motor. Meanwhile, Martin Bros. Customs tricks out the interior on an iconic 1932 Ford Roadster.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: With updates well underway on custom car guru Joe Martin's prized '65 Pontiac Catalina, Joe and the boys at Martin Bros. Customs give the ol' choppy-doo to a '41 DeSoto that has seen better days.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A longtime customer has his eye set on a car from Joe's personal collection, a 1967 Nova; Joe counters by offering up a 1966 Nova, with the guarantee that it will be twice the car Joe's is; big brakes, big power, big wheels and more.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe pulls out all the stops to make the '66 Nova the car of his client's dreams; Joe doesn't just want a mean motor and big tires; he wants a chopped roof, but the car might be too far behind schedule for a chop, even if it does up the cool factor.

programme.desc: Joe and the crew button up the 1965 Riviera's wiring, interior and paint.

programme.desc: Nearly two years after adding a Hemi engine to a 1955 Chevrolet Bel Air, the guys finally get the Mopar-powered Tri-Five on the road, but not without a few problems along the way.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The episode features 2,600 miles, 530 cubic inches, 700 horsepower, six speeds, 17 mpg, and two fun visits with friends Justin "Big Chief" Shearer and Shawn "Murder Nova" Ellington from "Street Outlaws."

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys visit Turner's Auto Wrecking in Fresno, Calif., where they select a 1950 GMC short bed truck and jam to get it on the road back to Los Angeles.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Subaru's 2015 Legacy goes head-to-head with three of the guys project cars.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys are on a gearhead vacation, starting at the NHRA U.S. Nationals.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys are 34 episodes in and have no plans of slowing down.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike fulfill a dream that began four-plus years ago.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: What looks like a routine pick-up turns into a complicated case of betrayal, deceit, as well as quality nail care as Dog and company track down an fugitive alleged to be an abusive boyfriend with one too many friends in his close knit community.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Leland has to attend a Lamaze class before he can join the hunt--another Chapman is on the way! But when Dog starts to go after this accused jewelry thief without his fastest son, he learns that this fugitive puts the "R" in runner.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog likes to say, "The apple doesn't fall far from the tree," and this is a hunt where that is true. So will Dog be able to use one family member's troubled ways to catch another one in trouble with the law?

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: With Duane Lee back on the team, the rift in the Chapman clan appears over. But will time heal this wound or make it worse?

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's latest fugitive, doesn't think small when it comes to illegal drugs: he was carrying almost a pound of methamphetamine when he was arrested. Now he's on the run with his pregnant girlfriend on the high plains of Colorado.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A fugitive with a long criminal record has fled to Hawaii, and the bondsman on the mainland has asked Dog and the Posse for help. Dog doesn't have much information to work with, but he can use the felon's desire to impress his friends to track him down.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: With a long record of violence and abuse and weighing in at over 200lbs, Dog's target for the day does not sound like a gentle giant. When the trail grows cold Dog turns up the heat on the fugitive's brother and sister.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and company head to the Big Island in pursuit of two courthouse no-shows only to find that one of them appears to be posting status updates from Southern California.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: What looks like a routine pick-up turns into a complicated case of betrayal, deceit, as well as quality nail care as Dog and company track down an fugitive alleged to be an abusive boyfriend with one too many friends in his close knit community.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Leland has to attend a Lamaze class before he can join the hunt--another Chapman is on the way! But when Dog starts to go after this accused jewelry thief without his fastest son, he learns that this fugitive puts the "R" in runner.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog likes to say, "The apple doesn't fall far from the tree," and this is a hunt where that is true. So will Dog be able to use one family member's troubled ways to catch another one in trouble with the law?

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Back in Denver Dog discovers that recapturing the past can be more difficult then tracking down felons. On a day of more misses then hits in their fugitive hunting, Dog and Beth repeatedly collide with reminders of their early days.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A one-hour special that looks back at 2006, one of Dog's most tumultuous years, which has included the passing of Beth's father, Dog and Beth's wedding, the tragic death of Dog's daughter Barbara, and the sudden arrest of Dog, Tim, and Leland.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and his team are out to revoke bail on Eugene, a chronic heroin addict. They find him in a squalid apartment with a huge stockpile of syringes, and they can see that his physical condition is deteriorating.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog finds himself fighting two enemies--the law and his inner demons. He continues his legal battle to fight extradition to Mexico in connection with his 2003 capture of fugitive rapist Andrew Luster. His other struggle is private.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and his team fight the war on ice - crystal methamphetamine - on many fronts. They appear on a special anti-drug float in a parade. Then they go after bail-jumping Pana, a convicted drug dealer.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog shows his love of justice and children in this poignant episode. He begins by giving encouragement to a group of handicapped children and making them honorary members of his posse.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team begin their day by judging the local elementary school's talent show, where they declare all the kids to be winners.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Colorado bondsman Bobby Brown's got trouble and his name is Jackson. Weighing in at over 240lbs and standing six foot tall this bad boy has skipped out on a $10,000 bond.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is trying to cut down on smoking, but it's not easy with his high-stress job. Today, he must track down Walter, a fugitive who believes that the Canadian military has planted a chip in his tooth.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Leland has a full plate of fugitives in Kona, and the whole family heads to the Big Island to help. They capture Clifford, who has a nasty habit of hitting his wife.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team get a big surprise after they track down Bosco, a fugitive who they believe is addicted to methamphetamines. They discover he's off drugs, settling into a normal life with a new girlfriend, and is very friendly.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog tries to nab a fugitive named Wayne by tricking him. Dog calls Wayne to tell him that he's won a new vacuum cleaner and he should stick around to get it.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The boys get distracted by the bikini-clad lovelies on Waikiki when they hunt for Lucy, a homeless, alcoholic fugitive. Beth is amused by the boys, but this is serious business: Tim will have to pay the bond if Lucy isn't caught.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog faces a tough personal and professional situation when he must hunt down his friend, Ili, who has helped him on many busts. But now Ili's on the other side of the law. She's didn't come to court to answer charges that

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is out to make two grabs on two islands in one day. Part of the team is dispatched to Kona to nab a woman who skipped her court date. Meanwhile, Dog and the others hunt Patrick, a fugitive who's fighting in an Extreme Boxing event on the Big Island.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog has only a few days to catch a woman nicknamed Cats or forfeit Beth's $10,000 bond. But it won't be easy - Cats is eight months pregnant, so Dog will have to lure her in rather than risk a violent grab.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is in for a big surprise after he catches a fugitive named Jonaven in a sting operation. In a teary heart-to-heart talk, Dog finds out that Jonaven's father was killed in a shoot-out with police when Jonaven was only 9. Dog then

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog thinks he's got an average day of bounty hunting ahead of him, but he couldn't be more wrong. Beth calls a client, Daphne, whose bond they have to revoke and makes a shocking discovery.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today Leland and Dog make a quick visit to the police supply store to get some new gadgets for the team. But they can't linger because they've also got a fugitive to catch. Their target is reputed to have an explosive temper.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When Leland learns that one of his clients with a reputation for stealing has lost her co-signer and could be ready to run, Dog and the crew hop a plane to the Big Island.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is back in Colorado chasing a young man with a taste for trouble. He's fled to Texas but with his family's house on the line Dog is willing to try a risky strategy. He enlists the family in an elaborate hoax to lure the runner home.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today's hunt takes Dog far from the glittering hotels of Waikiki to the parts of Hawaii tourist rarely see, Oahu's ramshackle tent cities. The team searches for a woman who has lost almost everything, her home, her family and her spirit.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: This hunt is personal. Dog's good friend and fellow bondsman Chris is running out of time. He has only days to find his fugitive or risk losing his business. In his hunt Dog confronts duplicitous tipsters, vicious attack dogs, and hostile neighbors.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Wisconsin, a varsity athlete is blindfolded, gagged, and shoved into a van by four gunmen. The kidnappers contact the victim's family and demand $30,000, but offer no instructions on how to transfer the money. The victim's family contacts the police. The boy's captors tell his family they have shot him, and will kill him if they do not receive their money. At an agreed upon drop site, FBI agents approach the captor's vehicle, only to watch them flee and quickly be followed by authorities.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 90s, Washington, D.C. police were losing the battle against street gangs who enforced their territories with lethal violence. The homicide rate in the nation's capital climbed to the highest in the country. Local police turned to the FBI for help, but agents soon found themselves in the direct line of fire. In the fall of 1994, a gang member walked into police headquarters, killed two FBI agents and one detective, then turned the gun on himself.

programme.title: Los Archivos del FBI (Doblado)
programme.desc: El 21 de junio de 1964, tres defensores de los derechos civiles, uno blanco y uno negro, desaparecieron de Mississippi mientras cruzaban el condado de Neshoba. Una investigacin del FBI a gran escala llev a la recuperacin de los cuerpos de los hombres asesinados y la evidencia fsica fue recuperada y analizada. Los laboratorios del FBI confirmaron que todas excepto una de las balas usadas para asesinar a los hombres provenan de la misma arma. El FBI se gan la confianza de un informante, cuya informacin condujo a la condena de siete miembros del Ku Klux Klan local.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: This is the story of the FBI's first capture of an international Lebanese terrorist. In June 1985, the terrorist and his four accomplices hijacked Royal Jordanian flight #405 shortly before take off in Beirut, Lebanon. On board were American citizens, a professor and his teen son. The FBI opened a criminal investigation and worked with various other government agencies to form Operation Goldenrod, a task force specifically charged with bringing the terrorist to justice in 1989.

programme.desc: Scott Amendure thought the "Jenny Jones Show" was the perfect place to reveal to his friend Jonathan Schmitz that he had a crush on him; three days later, Schmitz shot Amendure to death.

programme.desc: Dr. Jack Kevorkian thought it was an act of mercy to help over 130 terminally ill patients die a peaceful, pain-free death; Michigan prosecutors said it was murder and spent years trying to get a jury to agree with them.

programme.desc: In tonight's second programme Gordon tackles a pub for the first time, getting to grips with The Fenwick Arms in rural Lancashire. The pub is run by landlord Brian who, after thirty years in the business and a quadruple heart-bypass, still puts in 120 hours a week and insists on laying down the law in the kitchen. Despite their best endeavours Brian and his partner Elaine are ~250k in debt, losing ~1500 a week and facing bankruptcy within three months unless there's a drastic reversal in their fortunes.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's programme Gordon finds a chef caught in a time warp when he tackles a picturesque but largely unfrequented upmarket restaurant in King's Lynn, a traditional market town on the Norfolk coast. For the last eighteen months ex Michelin-starred chef Nick has owned and run Rococo but his past success is now eluding him. The menu is past its sell-by date, the service is stuffy, the food is over-priced and the only thing being fed is his ego. Yet, despite debts of ~100k and the prospect of putting his home at risk and his young family on the streets, Nick continues to cook comatose in a 1990s fantasy land of his own making.

programme.title: The UnBelievable With Dan Aykroyd
programme.desc: Looking at outlandish inventions; a full-body gas mask for babies; Smell-o-Vision; a robot powered by eating slugs; inflatable airplanes; hidden cameras in contact lenses; coffin security systems.

programme.title: The UnBelievable With Dan Aykroyd
programme.desc: A blind man who uses bat-like powers of echolocation to navigate his surroundings; a samurai with reflexes faster than a speeding bullet; a man who's immune to electrocution.

programme.title: The UnBelievable With Dan Aykroyd
programme.desc: Human bones as a "miracle cure" for gout; living mummies buried alive; a truly bizarre Victorian way to lose weight -- with tapeworms; from daily rites to once-in-a-lifetime rituals, the stranger side of human nature is revealed in these rituals.

programme.title: The Secret of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: When the team works with a group of astronomy experts to conduct a telescope and rocket experiment at the Triangle Area on Skinwalker Ranch, they have their most incredible UAP encounter yet.

programme.title: The Secret of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: Former NIDS employee and retired Army Col. John Alexander visits the ranch; after the Skinwalker team repeat an experiment that he indicates may have opened a portal, they receive a mysterious signal that appears to be an attempt to communicate.

programme.title: The Secret of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: While uncovering evidence of a massive underground cave system said to exist beneath the ranch's mysterious mesa, the Skinwalker team also broadcasts a strange signal recorded on the property over the airwaves of a local radio station.

programme.title: The Secret of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: As the team drills into the solid rock mesa on Skinwalker Ranch, they discover a mysterious void containing an impenetrable object that causes one of the most dangerous and threatening happenings they've experienced so far.

programme.title: The Secret of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: After recovering metal fragments from a massive, dome-shaped object buried in the mesa on Skinwalker Ranch, the team conducts a scientific test that reveals shocking results.

programme.title: The Secret of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: When the team conducts its most ambitious experiment yet at the Triangle, it is shocked by what appears in the sky above Skinwalker Ranch.

programme.title: The Secret of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: With winter approaching and time running out, the team performs a three-dimensional scan of Skinwalker Ranch and makes an incredible discovery that may help explain some of the bizarre phenomena they have encountered on the property.

programme.title: The Secret of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: When the team works with a group of astronomy experts to conduct a telescope and rocket experiment at the Triangle Area on Skinwalker Ranch, they have their most incredible UAP encounter yet.

programme.title: The Secret of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: Former NIDS employee and retired Army Col. John Alexander visits the ranch; after the Skinwalker team repeat an experiment that he indicates may have opened a portal, they receive a mysterious signal that appears to be an attempt to communicate.

programme.title: The Secret of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: While uncovering evidence of a massive underground cave system said to exist beneath the ranch's mysterious mesa, the Skinwalker team also broadcasts a strange signal recorded on the property over the airwaves of a local radio station.

programme.title: The Secret of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: As the team drills into the solid rock mesa on Skinwalker Ranch, they discover a mysterious void containing an impenetrable object that causes one of the most dangerous and threatening happenings they've experienced so far.

programme.desc: After recovering metal fragments from a massive, dome-shaped object buried in the mesa on Skinwalker Ranch, the team conducts a scientific test that reveals shocking results.

programme.desc: A woman tries to prove her son's innocence after he becomes the prime suspect in the murder of a wealthy wife.

programme.title: I Survived
programme.desc: A family suffers tragedy in a deadly home invasion; a mountain biker is mauled by a mountain lion; a hotel receptionist fights to survive a brutal attack.

programme.desc: A lawyer has two death experiences shortly after undergoing heart surgery; a young college student who dies in a car crash travels back to her childhood accompanied by angels; and a heart attack victim's deceased relative sends her back to life.
